algorithm_technique: Greedy approach calculating minimum moves between characters
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the minimum time to type a word on a circular typewriter, considering pointer movement and typing time.
problem_summary_technical: Greedily calculate the shortest distance (clockwise or counterclockwise) between consecutive characters and add typing time.
key_insights: The problem can be solved greedily by always choosing the shortest path between consecutive characters on the circular keyboard.
The time to type a character is always 1 second.
The distance between two characters on a circular keyboard of 26 letters is `min(abs(char1 - char2), 26 - abs(char1 - char2))`.
The initial movement from 'a' to the first character is a separate calculation.
The modulo operator `% 26` is essential for handling circular distances correctly.
The solution iterates through the word once, making it linear in time complexity.
